field.name: summary
field.value: Should error when trying to use PerWebRequest lifestyle when linked against the client profile.

field.name: description
field.value:
=Problem=
When a component is set to PerWebRequest lifestyle and the client profile DLL has been used by mistake no error is displayed and Castle Windsor appears to fall back to a singleton lifestyle.
=Steps to reproduce= # Create a new web project # Use the Castle.Windsor 4.0-client DLL # Register a component using the PerWebRequest lifecycle
=Expected behaviour=
Some exception to occur alerting the developer to the error.
=Actual behaviour=
Silently falls back to singleton behaviour (as observed using the debugger).

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: How do you register that? Via xml, fluent API?

comment.author: Chris.Chilvers
comment.text: I've created a simple project that reproduces this problem here, https://github.com/chilversc/Castle-Windsor-IOC-342

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: I'm thinking perhaps the fluent API for doing that should be disabled in CP altogether...

comment.author: Chris.Chilvers
comment.text: That would also make sense, though an error would be nice in case someone does still find a way rather than falling back to singleton. Same should happen for any requested lifecycle I think, if the lifecycle is not available.
